text: The 1979 Stevenage Borough Council election took place on 3 May 1979. This was on the same day as other local elections. The entire council was up for election and the Labour Party retained control of the council. ==Overall results== |-bgcolor=#F6F6F6 | colspan=2 style="text-align: right; margin- right: 1em" | Total | style="text-align: right;" | 39 | colspan=5 | | style="text-align: right;" | 41,336 | style="text-align: right;" | |- |colspan="11" bgcolor=""| |- | style="background:"| | colspan="10"| Labour hold ==Ward results== ===Bandley Hill (3 seats)=== Location of Bandley Hill ward ===Bedwell Plash (3 seats)=== Location of Bedwell Plash ward ===Chells (2 seats)=== Location of Chells ward ===Longmeadow (3 seats)=== Location of Longmeadow ward ===Martins Wood (3 seats)=== Location of Martins Wood ward ===Mobbsbury (3 seats)=== Location of Mobbsbury ward ===Monkswood (3 seats)=== Location of Monkswood ward ===Old Stevenage (3 seats)=== Location of Old Stevenage ward ===Pin Green (3 seats)=== Location of Pin Green ward ===Roebuck (3 seats)=== Location of Roebuck ward ===St Nicholas (3 seats)=== Location of St Nicholas ward ===Shephall (3 seats)=== Location of Shephall ward ===Symonds Green (3 seats)=== Location of Symonds Green ward ===Wellfield (1 seat)=== Location of Wellfield ward ==References== 1979 Category:1979 English local elections Category:1970s in Hertfordshire
title: 1979 Stevenage Borough Council election
